page.title: 01Blakedown and Broome
page.content: Our area lies 20 miles west of Birmingham, the nearest towns are Kidderminster (3 miles S.W.) and Worcester (15 miles S).Blakedown and Broome are the two villages in our largely rural area. Despite its position, it is still a typical area of Worcestershire being mainly agricultural. There are no factories and few signs of the industrial sprawl that has spoiled other areas on the fringe of Birmingham. The green lush farmland dominates the area, broken only by the higher land of Barnett Hill in the S.W. Rainfall is high and many streams cross the area with lakes, springs and wells in abundance. Centuries ago the area was forested - being part of the ancient Forest of Wyre and many trees remain today in copses and hedgerows.
